sentences.sentence: The young King was fascinated by( 被...所吸引 ) rare( 稀有的 ) and costly materials, and he had sent many traders off to faraway places to find more of them.
He had his traders buy the finest fabrics( 布料 ), the most precious( 珍贵的 ) jewels( 珠宝 ), and all the most beautiful things that they could find.
But what fascinated( 吸引 ) him most was the robe( 礼袍 ), the crown( 王冠 ), and the scepter( 权杖 ), which were being made especially for him for his coronation( 加冕 ) ceremony( 典礼 ).
Indeed, this was what he was thinking about tonight, as he sat alone in his beautiful room.
He imagined the robe( 礼袍 ) made of thin gold fabric( 布料 ), and the crown( 王冠 ) covered with( 镶满... ) rubies( 红宝石 ), and the scepter( 权杖 ) with its rows and rings of pearls( 珍珠 ).
Each one had been designed by the most famous artists of the time,
and the young King had ordered that work be done day and night to make them, using the finest materials in the world.
When the young King imagined himself wearing such fine and beautiful things at his coronation( 加冕 ), he smiled to himself, and his eyes lit up with pleasure.
When the clock-tower rang for midnight, he called for his servants, and they came in to get him ready for bed.
They took off his fine clothes, washed his hands with rose-water, and spread flowers over his bed.
Then they left the room, and a few moments later the young King fell asleep.
As he slept, he dreamed, and this was his dream.
He dreamed that he was standing in a long room with a low ceiling( 天花板 ).
The room was filled with( 充满 ) the sound of many large machines that were making fabric( 布料 ).
There were tired-looking workers bent( 弯腰 ) forward over the machines, and the young King could see that some of them were children.
These children were pale, and very thin and hungry-looking, and their hands shook while they were working.
A terrible smell filled the place.
The air was dirty and thick, and the walls were wet from the damp( 湿气 ).
The young King went over to one of the workers, and stood by him and watched him.
The worker looked back at him angrily, and said, “What are you looking at? Have you been sent by our master( 雇主 ) to watch us?”
“Who is your master( 雇主 )?” asked the young King.
“He is a man like myself,” replied the worker.
“In truth, there is not much difference between us, except that he wears fine clothes and has plenty of food to eat,
while I have neither fine clothes to wear, nor enough food to eat.”
“This land is free,” said the young King, “and you are not a slave( 奴隶 ).”
“In war,” answered the worker, “the strong make slaves of( 奴役 ) the weak, and in peace the rich make slaves of( 奴役 ) the poor.
We must work to live, and they give us such low pay for our work that we die from( 死于... ) hunger.
We work for them all day long, and they keep the gold, while our children die young, and the faces of those we love become old and hard.
We grow the grapes, while someone else drinks the wine.
We plant the grain( 谷物 ), while someone else eats the bread.
Some men may call us free, but in truth we are all slaves( 奴隶 ).”
“Is it like this for all of you?” he asked.
“Yes, it is,” answered the worker.
“The masters( 雇主 ) give us work, and we must do what they say.
The priest( 牧师 ) rides by and says his prayers( 祷告 ), and nobody cares about us.
Poverty( 穷困 ) walks our street with her hungry eyes, and Sin( 罪恶 ) follows close behind her.
Misery( 苦难 ) wakes us in the morning, and Shame sits with us at night.
But what are these things to you? You are not one of us.
Your face is too happy.”
And he turned away with a frown( 皱眉 ), and went back to his work.
The young King saw that the worker was making a thin gold fabric( 织物 ).
A feeling of panic( 惊慌 ) came over the young King, and he said to the worker, “What is this that you are making?”
“It is the robe( 礼袍 ) for the coronation( 加冕 ) of the young King,” he answered. “What is that to you?”
The young King gave a loud cry and woke up( 醒来 ), and saw that he was in his own room.

article_info.previous: 少年国王在加冕仪式的前夜独自待在一间房间。他的母亲是老国王唯一的公主，公主爱上了一个神秘的陌生人，并且不顾国王的反对和神秘人秘密地结婚了，九个月后生下了少年国王。但是少年国王却被偷走了，公主心碎而死。多年后，老国王命仆人把少年国王带回王宫并把王位传给了他。少年国王对王宫里的漂亮珍奇的玩意儿很着迷。
